newsitem.title: USA: Northwest Air March load factor rises.
newsitem.headline: Northwest Air March load factor rises.

text.p: Northwest Airlines Inc said Monday its systemwide passenger load factor rose 1.9 points to 77.3 percent from 75.4 percent.
Available seat miles for the month rose 5.2 percent to 8.10 billion from 7.70 billion. Revenue passenger miles gained 7.8 percent to 6.26 billion from 5.81 billion.
Cargo ton miles for March rose to 5.3 percent to 192.8 million from 183.1 million.

Northwest said its international passenger load factor in March rose 0.4 points to 81.5 percent from 81.1 percent. Domestic load factor for the month increased 2.8 points to 74.7 percent from 71.9 percent.

Year-to-date, systemwide load factor was 72 percent, up 1.8 points from 70.2 percent a year ago. Available seat miles rose 3.9 percent to 23.05 billion and revenue passenger miles increased 6.5 percent to 16.59 billion.
